title: Machine Learning Design Strategies for Vibration Control in Cement-Based Metamaterials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Materials Science and Vibration Theory, Foundations of Programming
context.additional_context: Simulation-based practical training for novice professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields

learning_goals: Students can explain dynamic modeling techniques for analyzing bandgap characteristics in metamaterials.
Learners can perform inverse design processes to optimize vibration isolation performance using machine learning (MLP and genetic algorithms).
Learners can implement customized vibration control strategies by adjusting density and geometric variables in simulation environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
